page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Nothing of national{historical} interest has happened in or near Lapford,but people have lived here for well over two and a half thousand years.{Excavations}at Bury Barton,just South of our area and only a mile from Lapford, have shown that people have lived there since{Celtic}times at least.A protective bank and ditch was built there then to guard the hilltop setlement, and those banks still remains.The second{Roman}Legion from Exeter sent a large cohort north west to North Devon and Cornwall,and built a fort within the old{Celtic}walls, the corner watch towers of which have been recently excavated.Then when the{ {Saxons}arrived soon after 660 A.D a farm was built on the same site,and the first little church and homesteads built in Lapford.
